qas.question: What did Romans use as money in the 6th through 3rd centuriesBC?
Who had his own coins produced out of brass?
During the 6th through 3rd centuries BC how much copper was mined in Rome?
Cctavianus Augustus Caesar had his coins made out of what alloys?
What became more important than the copper value for Roman coins?
What did aliens use as money in the 6th through 3rd centuries BC?
Who had his own trees produced out of brass?
How much copper was stolen in Rome during the 6th through 3rd centuries BC?
What became less important than the copper value for Roman coins?

context: The cultural role of copper has been important, particularly in currency. Romans in the 6th through 3rd centuries BC used <a0_0><b5_0>copper lumps<b5_0/><a0_0/> as money. At first, the copper itself was valued, but gradually <a4_0><b8_0>the shape and look<b8_0/><a4_0/> of the copper became more important. <a1_0><b6_0>Julius Caesar<b6_0/><a1_0/> had his own coins made from brass, while Octavianus Augustus Caesar's coins were made from <a3_0>Cu-Pb-Sn alloys<a3_0/>. With an estimated annual output of around <a2_0><b7_0>15,000 t<b7_0/><a2_0/>, Roman copper mining and smelting activities reached a scale unsurpassed until the time of the Industrial Revolution; the provinces most intensely mined were those of Hispania, Cyprus and in Central Europe.
